data.title: Another Outstanding establishment
data.text: They have the best brunch in town and an excellent menu and an outstanding choice of wines.  Have not had a dish here that is anything less than outstanding.  A friendly staff is the icing on the cake.

data.title: Bad food...Low Quality
data.text: I took my mother and father (visiting from LA) there with my family after a visit to the Air & Space Museum. The service was awesome, but the food is mediocre and not worth the cost. You'd be better off eating fast food. Sorry, but this place has potential to standout considering there aren't many restaurants in the Downtown Hampton area.

data.title: Comfort food at its best!
data.text: Comfy and warm ambiance in an old World pub setting. Friendly service and nice lighting. The crab carbonara and crab ravioli were both savory and excellent! Mussels in wine sauce was excellent and at $16, a bargain. Arrive before 7pm for drink specials. It's in a very pretty part of the historic district. Loved it!

data.title: Love their Sunday brunch!
data.text: The food is alway exceptional and the service is Divine!  The good is fresh and unlike any other restaurant.  Anytime I get a chance I go there.

data.title: Different Seafood & basic
data.text: Went a long time ago, Very busy place, food very good and fun. Will try again with a large group nextonth.

data.title: Wow!
data.text: Great little place in downtown Hampton! Place had a local's pub feel. I started off with a bowl of conch chowder. There was a good amount of conch in there. It was seasoned very well..and had a nice spicey kick. For my main course I went with the steak of the day. It was cooked and seasoned to perfection, laid atop of a mound of roughly mashed russett potatoes and baby broccoli. I ended with a creme brulee cheesecake...which was freaking ridiculous! All members of my party loved the place (had salmon and the penne pasta)

data.title: Sunday brunch
data.text: What an amazing find!  The seared scallop Benedict was delicious! Great job. Ryan our server was very hospitable and made sure we had all we asked for. Recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Great food and service!
data.text:
Great food, atmosphere and attentive service!  Visited at 5 pm on a Thursday and we were the only customers when we entered. Waitress was outstanding!  Extremely knowledgable and friendly. 

We thoroughly enjoyed the jambalaya, Mac and cheese, Parmesan and herb crusted salmon over Mediterranean hash (delish!) oh and don't forget to try a whiskey sour made with egg white.  Sounds crazy but delicious!! 

No kids menu but my kids loved the Mac and cheese and the waitress offered Shirley Temples (cherry juice, Sprite and grenadine) with lots of cherries.  She even brought a whole bowl of maraschino cherries to spoil my boys.  

Beautiful inside and charming historic district we loved walking through from the free parking structure close to the air and space museum.  

Loved every bit of our experience and would highly recommend!

data.title: Conch and Bucket
data.text: Great dining experience. Staff very friendly and helpful. Crabcakes and Seafood Sub are outstanding. For dessert recommend Hummingbird Cake.

data.title: Old Hampton at its finest
data.text: Delicious food. I had the NY Strip, my friend had the Mac & Cheese with seafood. Both were very good, nice wine selection as well.

data.title: Quaint Place
data.text: A very charming neighborhood with street parking.   Must try Smoked Trout Spread with Grilled Garlic Bread and Capellini Mussels!  Plenty of food for two, and selection of beers on tap.

data.title: Definitely worth coming back to enjoy!! Kudos to the Chef & Jess
data.text: We were referred to C&B by a business colleague and WOW!!! Promptly seated, our server Jessica was outstanding! Drinks and apps chop chop efficient.  My Fred Flinstone steak was perfect! The pork chop dinner and scallop dinner each person raved about how exceptional each tasted. The portions are for a triathlete! Oh, definitely try the smoked trout appetizer it was delicious! Highly recommended! both women commented on how clean the powder room was, Kudos all the way around!!

data.title: Pleasant & Accomodating
data.text: 4 of us had a pleasant and tasty dinner.  The piped-in music was a bit loud so we asked that it be turned down and it was without a problem.  All the entrees were good.  The steak special was HUGE - too much for one person and the glazed pork chop was delicious.  Drinks were well-made and generous.

data.title: Awesome Place!
data.text: We found this great place after touring the air and space museum. We were greeted and served immediately. We started with the smoked trout appetizer, yum. We finished with the highly recommended daily special which was pan seared scallops over seasoned rice and grilled asparagus. All cooked to perfection. Our friends that live in Hampton will be coming back. We will too next time we visit. Sorry I didn't think to take pictures.

data.title: Relax and enjoy the evening.
data.text: The sort of place you could sit and linger all evening, good choice of well cooked (mainly) seafood, wide choice of inexpensive wines and cocktails, loved the Key Lime Martini. Efficient friendly service.

data.title: Great time with friends
data.text: Really great place in general. Been to the tap house and they are ran by the same people! Service was great and the food was even better.

data.title: Wonderful Atmosphere and Great Meal Selection
data.text: What a great spot!  We stopped into the Conch and Bucket on our first night in Hampton.  Such a pretty place to sit back and enjoy an evening.  The menu offers a great variety of  dishes to choose from.  Not what I would call "traditional" offerings but appealing to any and all palettes. Beyond their standard menu there is a significant menu board of specials that will truly delight.  We shared the Zucchini Noodle Pancake, and I have to say it is wonderful, you will not be disappointed (this is a very generous portion!   I also had the Crispy Shrimp Burrito which was just perfect, well seasoned and freshly made. If we had been in Hampton longer the Conch and Bucket would have been up for a revisit from us!

data.title: Great Food!
data.text:
A late dinner for my hubby and me turned out to be wonderful. Greeted by Jessica and seated by the window be were served  water and menus quickly. Jessica explained the menu and specials with great knowledge and we ordered the Rockfish
special and a shrimp and corn chowder. The food came out hot and freshly prepared 
and we so enjoyed the meal. Jessica came back to check on us a few times. A wonderful meal and we certainly will be back soon.

data.title: Great Atmosphere
data.text: This really cool place had a great and really trendy ambiance. They are known for really good mac and cheese. I got the mussels, and for the price, you get a TON of them. Also, got a bottle of Corona for $2...not on happy hour. Cheapest place I've ever gotten a Corona ever. They have lots of beers and wine selections too.

data.title: great place for a private party
data.text: Was invited to a friend's surprise birthday celebration at Conch and Bucket which turned out to be a great choice! Great finger foods including smoked trout dip with pita points, great shrimp along with tasty drinks. Staff was most hospitable and guests were enjoyable. Can't wait to return.
